column7: An elective course for undergraduate students who are interested in learning nanotechnology and its applications in biology and medicine. Key topics include: (1) cancer biology and clinical oncology, (2) fundamentals of nanoscience, (3) principles of nanoscale engineering, (4) major classes of nanoparticles and nanostructures, and (5) nanomedicine - technologies and applications 3 undergraduate hours. No graduate credit. Approved for Letter and S/U grading. Prerequisite: BIOE 206, CHEM 232.
column9: 3 undergraduate hours. No graduate credit. Approved for Letter and S/U grading. Prerequisite: BIOE 206, CHEM 232.
